quoteFirst: The submarine followed, and a man was seen on the conning-tower shouting directions. The lifeboat then rowed towards the ship, and this apparently annoyed the Hun, who now began semaphoring the boats; but at
quoteLast: the submarine was only 50 yards off, and was bearing one point before the beam, so all _Pargustâ€™s_ guns were able to bear nicely. Fire was therefore opened, the first shot from the 4-inch gun hitting the base of the conning-tower and removing the two periscopes.
title: Q-Ships and Their Story
author: Chatterton, E. Keble (Edward Keble), 1878-1944
